channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: For one volunteer firefighter in Pine Haven, Wyoming, helping is the biggest reward
item.description: Volunteer firefighters are essential in many small, rural communities. They're especially needed in the Western U.S. where fires have been growing. We'll meet one of them.
item.content:encoded: Volunteer firefighters are essential in many small, rural communities. They're especially needed in the Western U.S. where fires have been growing. We'll meet one of them.
item.dc:creator: Chris Clements

item.title: How the town of Cortina, Italy, is preparing to co-host the 2026 Winter Olympics
item.description: Residents of Cortina, Italy, worry about the effects of the 2026 Winter Olympics on their town.
item.content:encoded: Residents of Cortina, Italy, worry about the effects of the 2026 Winter Olympics on their town.
item.dc:creator: Kyle McKinnon

item.title: Sen. Peter Welch on efforts in Congress to fund SNAP amid the shutdown
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers talks with Sen. Peter Welch of Vermont about his support for a bill to provide SNAP benefits to recipients in spite of the shutdown.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers talks with Sen. Peter Welch of Vermont about his support for a bill to provide SNAP benefits to recipients in spite of the shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Handel

item.title: The 'clippers' who make internet stars viral
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Bloomberg digital culture reporter Cecilia D'Anastasio about an emerging industry of video editing -- designed to help content creators go viral online.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Bloomberg digital culture reporter Cecilia D'Anastasio about an emerging industry of video editing -- designed to help content creators go viral online.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Pierre

item.title: Time for an interstellar flyby! Meet 3i/ATLAS, a very old comet
item.description: Scientists are observing the skies as the comet 3i/ATLAS makes a close flyby of Earth.
item.content:encoded: Scientists are observing the skies as the comet 3i/ATLAS makes a close flyby of Earth.
item.dc:creator: Gabriel J. SÃ¡nchez

item.title: Federal Reserve cuts interest rates again as concerns grow about U.S. job market
item.description: The Federal Reserve lowered its benchmark interest rate today for the second time in six weeks. The central bank is trying to shore up the sagging job market.
item.content:encoded: The Federal Reserve lowered its benchmark interest rate today for the second time in six weeks. The central bank is trying to shore up the sagging job market.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: A day after a deadly police raid in Rio de Janeiro, 2 very different stories emerge
item.description: More than 130 people were killed in Rio de Janeiro's deadliest-ever police raid targeting a major drug cartel.
item.content:encoded: More than 130 people were killed in Rio de Janeiro's deadliest-ever police raid targeting a major drug cartel.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: Phyllis Trible, a groundbreaking feminist Bible scholar, dies at 92
item.description: Noted feminist Bible scholar Phyllis Trible influenced generations of Christians. She died this month at the age of 92.
item.content:encoded: Noted feminist Bible scholar Phyllis Trible influenced generations of Christians. She died this month at the age of 92.
item.dc:creator: Monique Parsons

item.title: International Committee of the Red Cross president on transporting remains and delivering aid in Gaza
item.description: Mirjana Spoljaric, president of the International Committee of the Red Cross, discusses how the ICRC operates amid renewed violence in Gaza and works to uphold humanitarian principles during the fragile ceasefire.
item.content:encoded: Mirjana Spoljaric, president of the International Committee of the Red Cross, discusses how the ICRC operates amid renewed violence in Gaza and works to uphold humanitarian principles during the fragile ceasefire.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Ofman

item.title: Food banks and state governments work to bridge aid gaps as SNAP cutoff looms
item.description: Tens of millions of people are at risk of losing federal food and nutrition benefits due to the government shutdown. Food bank administrators say they are working overtime to meet demand.
item.content:encoded: Tens of millions of people are at risk of losing federal food and nutrition benefits due to the government shutdown. Food bank administrators say they are working overtime to meet demand.
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt
